ygData.messageBody:
Cool, sounds like I'll have more Enchanter friendly options soon. It's been
about 10 levels now since I really felt comfortable grouping with an
enchanter. I used Siren's last night in a group and it was pretty
effective. The necromancer was laughing pretty hard at the antics of 'My'
war boned skeleton. He was very jealous of 'My' skeletons superior sitting
skills, heh heh.

Kitasi Faegehearper
Full time pain-in-the-keister, part time Necromancer

It's very common for me to be grouped with an enchanter. In fact, an
enchanter, bard, and monk are the core of our 6 person Fire Giant runs (WAY
fun). We also add a shaman, a cleric, and the 6th has been a paladin
(because
he's my game husband hehe) but that is the spot to put another class.

Similarly, one group, or the core group for a larger Sebilis raid, almost
always has a bard and an enchanter.

The bard is needed to cut the down time. I agree with Lyrnia ( believe it
was
her) that our strength lies there. But I have pulled in Sebilis, done crowd
control, been battle bard...just adapted to the conditions.
